title: How is the best method to prepare for a divorce financially as a couple lives together for the kids and to pay off joint bills
question: My husband and I have been married for 16 years and have two kids 15 and 9 years old. We are living together for their emotional stability and to pay off debt and save monies to hopefully separate or divorce in the near future. I told him I would seek spousal support, and child support as both children would live with me most of the time when we divorce. How does divorce affect us with bank accounts in both our names and how does divorce effect his retirement; and we are still filing our
answers: Possibly. There needs to be something definitive that shows you are in fact separated. The fact that you physically still live together and share bank accounts would indicate that you are still living as a married couple. If you are still considered a married couple by the courts then any assets or debts are still considered community property and should be divided accordingly.
